root.name: Crash 'N the Boys: Street Challenge
root.description: OverviewCrash 'N the Boys: Street Challenge is a 1992 gang themed Olympic sports game for the NES. The game was developed and published by Technos, and was part of their Kunio-kun franchise. The game features five different teams of five players competing in five different sporting events. The game can be played by 1-4 players, but there is no need for a multitap since only two teams compete against each other at a time in the versus events.EventsIndividualHammer Throw GolfRoof Top JumpingVersus400 Meter HurdlesSwimmingFighting SceneTeamsSouth Side HighWashington High SchoolLincoln High SchoolJefferson High SchoolTeam Thornley (This team is CPU controlled only.)Triviain the Scott Pilgrim graphic novel series, Crash 'N the Boys is used as the name of one of Sex Bob-Omb's. The band makes a brief appearance at the end of the first chapter of the video game Scott Pilgrim vs. The World: The Game.
